English.Text: The storm came from nowhere, wrecking your ship on coral-strewn shores. For a time your crew feel like children again— dancing along the sand and bathing in the sun, as they await a verdict on the damaged hull. When it comes, the news is not good— extensive repair is needed, and with supplies so short, there is considerable disagreement. Why concentrate on repairs, given how long that may take, when both food and water are so urgently needed?
